name: Bolzano's theorem
description:
# Bolzano's theorem

## Description

In this kata, you will have to use the Bolzano's theorem to find a root of a function. First of all, let's define what the Bolzano's theorem is. 

When we have a continuous function `$f(x)$` in an interval `$[a, b]$` and `$f(a) \cdot f(b) \lt 0$` (`$f(a)$` and `$f(b)$` have different sign), Bolzano's theorem says that it exists a number `$c \in (a, b)$` so that `$c$` is a root of the function `$f(x)$` (`$f(c) = 0$`).

If you need more information, visit this [Superprof page](https://www.superprof.co.uk/resources/academic/maths/calculus/limits/bolzanos-theorem.html) about the Bolzano's thorem.

## Your task

You have to write a function called `bolzanos_theorem`, that will receive the following parameters:

- `function`: the function you have to evaluate. It will be like `x**2 - 1`, where `x` is the parameter to solve for.
- `solution_interval`: the interval where the root we are looking for is contained.
- `decimals`: the number of decimals your solution must have.

IMPORTANT: We are looking for truncated roots, as they will be irrational.
